existing_custody_order.reasoning: Paragraph 2.2 identifies an Existing Order entered May 15, 2021 awarding Plaintiff primary physical custody and granting Defendant alternate weekends and one midweek visit, which sufficiently pleads a prior custody/parenting-time judgment.

specific_modification_sought.reasoning: Paragraphs 6.2–6.5 and 7.1 set out concrete remedies sought (prohibit Resident Partner during unsupervised parenting time; require supervised visits; interim restrictions; disclosure of Resident Partner’s identity/criminal history; access to records), which plainly specify the requested modification(s).

material_substantial_change.reasoning: Paragraphs 4.1–4.6 allege post-judgment facts that bear directly on the children’s safety and welfare—Defendant’s new cohabiting partner with a prior assault conviction and prior restraining order; reports of yelling, slamming doors, and physical aggression in the children’s presence; an alleged incident leaving a visible mark; and a police call—allegations that, if proven, constitute a material and substantial change since entry of the Existing Order.

best_interests_of_child.reasoning: Paragraphs 5.1–5.4 tie the alleged post-judgment facts to the statutory best-interests standard and expressly allege that restricting or supervising Defendant’s parenting time is necessary to protect the children’s physical safety and emotional wellbeing; the complaint therefore alleges that the requested modification is in the children’s best interests.
